title: Use recipes
code: library(metasurvey) #> Welcome to: metasurvey version 0.0.2 #> use_copy: TRUE #> metasurvey.engine: data.table #> metasurvey.api.key: ******** #> metasurvey.user: public #> metasurvey.lazy_processing: TRUE recetas_mercado_trabajo <- get_recipe(   "ech",   "2022",   topic = "ingreso" ) #> The API returned 1 recipes

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mauro Loprete. Author, maintainer. Natalia da Silva. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Loprete M, da Silva N (2025). metasurvey: Survey Processing Meta-Programming. R package version 0.0.2, https://github.com/metasurveyr/metasurvey.
code: @Manual{,   title = {metasurvey: Survey Processing with Meta-Programming},   author = {Mauro Loprete and Natalia {da Silva}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.2},   url = {https://github.com/metasurveyr/metasurvey}, }

title: Survey Processing with Meta-Programming
text: metasurvey provides tools streamline analysis complex survey data using metaprogramming reproducible pipelines. integrates tightly survey package especially helpful working complex survey designs recurrent estimations time (e.g., rotating panels repeated cross-sections). Key features: Tidy-style API survey processing estimation. Reproducible survey pipelines steps workflows. Support advanced variance estimation methods (e.g., bootstrap replicates). Recipes reusable metadata manage harmonized survey definitions time.

title: Survey Processing with Meta-Programming
text: Install stable version CRAN: development version GitHub:

title: Survey Processing with Meta-Programming
code: library(metasurvey) library(magrittr)  ech_2022 <- load_survey(     metasurvey::load_survey_example(         "ech",         "ech_2022"     ),     svy_edition = "2022",     svy_type = "ech",     svy_weight = add_weight(annual = "w_ano"),     recipes = get_recipe(         "ech",         "2022"     ) )

title: Survey Processing with Meta-Programming
text: example uses Uruguayan ECH panel bootstrap replicate weights. First, download unzip example data: run following R script download unzip data: , can run following analysis:
code: curl -o example-data.zip "https://informe-tfg.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/example-data.zip" mkdir example-data mkdir temp && unzip example-data.zip -d temp && mv temp/example-data/* example-data/ && rm -rf temp rm example-data.zip # download_example_data.R  # This script downloads and unzips the example-data.zip from S3  download_example_ech <- function() {   zip_url <- "https://informe-tfg.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/example-data.zip"   dest_zip <- "example-data.zip"   temp_dir <- tempfile("example-data")    # Download the zip file   download.file(zip_url, destfile = dest_zip, mode = "wb")   message("Downloaded example-data.zip")    # Unzip to temporary directory   dir.create(temp_dir)   unzip(dest_zip, exdir = temp_dir)   message("Unzipped example-data.zip")    target_dir <- file.path("example-data")   dir.create(target_dir, recursive = TRUE, showWarnings = FALSE)   file.rename(list.files(file.path(temp_dir, "example-data"), full.names = TRUE),                file.path(target_dir, basename(list.files(file.path(temp_dir, "example-data")))))   message("Moved unzipped data to chapters/example-data")    # Cleanup   unlink(dest_zip)   unlink(temp_dir, recursive = TRUE)   message("Cleanup done") }  # Run the function download_example_ech() library(metasurvey) library(magrittr)  path_dir <- file.path("example-data", "ech", "ech_2023")  ech_2023 <- load_panel_survey(   path_implantation = file.path(path_dir, "ECH_implantacion_2023.csv"),   path_follow_up = file.path(path_dir, "seguimiento"),   svy_type = "ECH_2023",   svy_weight_implantation = add_weight(annual = "W_ANO"),   svy_weight_follow_up = add_weight(     monthly = add_replicate(       "W",       replicate_path = file.path(         path_dir,         c(           "Pesos replicados Bootstrap mensuales enero_junio 2023",           "Pesos replicados Bootstrap mensuales julio_diciembre 2023"         ),         c(           "Pesos replicados mensuales enero_junio 2023",           "Pesos replicados mensuales Julio_diciembre 2023"         )       ),       replicate_id = c("ID" = "ID"),       replicate_pattern = "wr[0-9]+",       replicate_type = "bootstrap"     )   ) )  ech_2023 <- ech_2023 %>%   step_recode("pea", POBPCOAC %in% 2:5 ~ 1, .default = 0, comment = "PEA", .level = "follow_up") %>%   step_recode("pet", e27 >= 14 ~ 1, .default = 0, comment = "PET", .level = "follow_up") %>%   step_recode("po", POBPCOAC == 2 ~ 1, .default = 0, comment = "PO", .level = "follow_up") %>%   step_recode("pd", POBPCOAC %in% 3:5 ~ 1, .default = 0, comment = "PD", .level = "follow_up")  ech_2023_bake <- bake_steps(ech_2023)  workflow_result <- workflow(   survey = extract_surveys(ech_2023_bake, quarterly = 1:4),   survey::svyratio(~pea, denominator = ~pet),   survey::svyratio(~po, denominator = ~pet),   survey::svyratio(~pd, denominator = ~pea),   estimation_type = "quarterly:monthly",   rho = 0.5,   R = 5 / 6 )  workflow_result

title: PoolSurvey Class — PoolSurvey
text: class represents collection surveys grouped specific periods (e.g., monthly, quarterly, annual). provides methods access manipulate grouped surveys.

title: Recipe Class — Recipe
text: class represents recipe processing survey data. recipe includes metadata name, edition, survey type, user, description, list steps applied survey data.

title: Recipe Class — Recipe
text: name string representing name recipe. edition string indicating edition survey associated recipe. survey_type string specifying type survey (e.g., "eaii", "ech"). default_engine string indicating default engine used processing. depends_on list dependencies required recipe. user string representing user creator recipe. description string providing description recipe. id unique identifier recipe. steps list steps applied survey data. doi string representing DOI (Digital Object Identifier) recipe. bake logical value indicating whether recipe baked (processed) immediately. topic string specifying topic recipe.

title: Recipe Class — Recipe
code: Recipe$new(   name,   edition,   survey_type,   default_engine,   depends_on,   user,   description,   steps,   id,   doi,   topic )

title: Recipe Class — Recipe
text: name string representing name recipe. edition string indicating edition survey associated recipe. survey_type string specifying type survey (e.g., "eaii", "ech"). default_engine string indicating default engine used processing. depends_on list dependencies required recipe. user string representing user creator recipe. description string providing description recipe. steps list steps applied survey data. id unique identifier recipe. doi string representing DOI (Digital Object Identifier) recipe. topic string specifying topic recipe.

title: RotativePanelSurvey Class — RotativePanelSurvey
text: class represents rotative panel survey, includes implantation follow-surveys. provides methods access manipulate survey data, steps, recipes, workflows, designs.

title: RotativePanelSurvey Class — RotativePanelSurvey
text: implantation survey object representing implantation survey. follow_up list survey objects representing follow-surveys. type string indicating type survey. default_engine string specifying default engine used processing. steps list steps applied survey. recipes list recipes associated survey. workflows list workflows associated survey. design design object survey. periodicity list containing periodicity implantation follow-surveys.

title: RotativePanelSurvey Class — RotativePanelSurvey
text: RotativePanelSurvey$new() RotativePanelSurvey$get_implantation() RotativePanelSurvey$get_follow_up() RotativePanelSurvey$get_type() RotativePanelSurvey$get_default_engine() RotativePanelSurvey$get_steps() RotativePanelSurvey$get_recipes() RotativePanelSurvey$get_workflows() RotativePanelSurvey$get_design() RotativePanelSurvey$print() RotativePanelSurvey$clone()

title: RotativePanelSurvey Class — RotativePanelSurvey
code: RotativePanelSurvey$new(   implantation,   follow_up,   type,   default_engine,   steps,   recipes,   workflows,   design )

title: RotativePanelSurvey Class — RotativePanelSurvey
text: implantation survey object representing implantation survey. follow_up list survey objects representing follow-surveys. type string indicating type survey. default_engine string specifying default engine used processing. steps list steps applied survey. recipes list recipes associated survey. workflows list workflows associated survey. design design object survey.

title: RotativePanelSurvey Class — RotativePanelSurvey
code: RotativePanelSurvey$get_follow_up(   index = length(self$follow_up),   monthly = NULL,   quarterly = NULL,   semiannual = NULL,   annual = NULL )

title: RotativePanelSurvey Class — RotativePanelSurvey
text: index integer specifying index follow-survey retrieve. monthly vector integers specifying monthly intervals. quarterly vector integers specifying quarterly intervals. semiannual vector integers specifying semiannual intervals. annual vector integers specifying annual intervals.

what: Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
title: Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
text: Step class used define manage individual steps survey workflow. step can include operations recoding variables, computing new variables, validating dependencies.

title: Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
text: Step class part survey workflow system designed encapsulate information operations required single step workflow. Steps can chained together form complete workflow.

title: Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
text: name name step. edition edition survey associated step. survey_type type survey associated step. type type operation performed step (e.g., "compute", "recode"). new_var name new variable created step, applicable. exprs list expressions defining step's operations. call function call associated step. svy_before survey object step applied. default_engine default engine used processing step. depends_on list variables step depends . comments Comments notes step. bake logical value indicating whether step executed.

title: Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
text: Initializes new Step object provided attributes.

title: Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
code: Step$new(   name,   edition,   survey_type,   type,   new_var,   exprs,   call,   svy_before,   default_engine,   depends_on,   comments,   bake = !lazy_default() )

title: Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
text: name name step. edition edition survey associated step. survey_type type survey associated step. type type operation performed step (e.g., "compute", "recode"). new_var name new variable created step, applicable. exprs list expressions defining step's operations. call function call associated step. svy_before survey object step applied. default_engine default engine used processing step. depends_on list variables step depends . comments Comments notes step. bake logical value indicating whether step executed.

title: Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
Step Class Represents a step in a survey workflow. — Step
code: step <- Step$new(   name = "example_step",   edition = "2023",   survey_type = "example_survey",   type = "compute",   new_var = "example_var",   exprs = list(a = 1, b = 2),   call = NULL,   svy_before = NULL,   default_engine = NULL,   depends_on = list("var1", "var2"),   comments = "Example step",   bake = FALSE ) print(step) #> <Step> #>   Public: #>     bake: FALSE #>     call: NULL #>     clone: function (deep = FALSE)  #>     comments: Example step #>     default_engine: NULL #>     depends_on: list #>     edition: 2023 #>     exprs: list #>     initialize: function (name, edition, survey_type, type, new_var, exprs, call,  #>     name: example_step #>     new_var: example_var #>     survey_type: example_survey #>     svy_before: NULL #>     type: compute

title: Survey Class — Survey
text: class represents survey object various attributes methods manage survey data, design, steps, recipes, workflows.

title: Survey Class — Survey
text: data survey data. edition edition survey. type type´ survey. periodicity periodicity survey. default_engine default engine used survey. weight weight(s) associated survey. steps list steps applied survey. recipes list recipes associated survey. workflows list workflows associated survey. design survey design object(s). active list active bindings dynamic properties survey.

title: Survey Class — Survey
text: Survey$new() Survey$get_data() Survey$get_edition() Survey$get_type() Survey$set_data() Survey$set_edition() Survey$set_type() Survey$set_weight() Survey$print() Survey$add_step() Survey$add_recipe() Survey$add_workflow() Survey$bake() Survey$head() Survey$str() Survey$set_design() Survey$update_design() Survey$clone()

title: Survey Class — Survey
code: Survey$new(   data,   edition,   type,   psu,   engine,   weight,   design = NULL,   steps = NULL,   recipes = list() )

title: Survey Class — Survey
text: data survey data. edition edition survey. type type survey. psu Primary sampling unit (PSU). engine engine used survey. weight weight(s) survey. design Optional survey design. steps Optional list steps. recipes Optional list recipes.

title: Survey Class — Survey

title: Read panel survey files from different formats and create a RotativePanelSurvey object — load_panel_survey
Read panel survey files from different formats and create a RotativePanelSurvey object — load_panel_survey
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # example code path_dir <- here::here("example-data", "ech", "ech_2023") ech_2023 <- load_panel_survey(   path_implantation = file.path(     path_dir,     "ECH_implantacion_2023.csv"   ),   path_follow_up = file.path(     path_dir,     "seguimiento"   ),   svy_type = "ECH_2023",   svy_weight_implantation = add_weight(     annual = "W_ANO"   ),   svy_weight_follow_up = add_weight(     monthly = add_replicate(       "W",       replicate_path = file.path(         path_dir,         c(           "Pesos replicados Bootstrap mensuales enero_junio 2023",           "Pesos replicados Bootstrap mensuales julio_diciembre 2023"         ),         c(           "Pesos replicados mensuales enero_junio 2023",           "Pesos replicados mensuales Julio_diciembre 2023"         )       ),       replicate_id = c("ID" = "ID"),       replicate_pattern = "wr[0-9]+",       replicate_type = "bootstrap"     )   ) ) } # } # Example of loading a panel survey panel_survey <- load_panel_survey(   path_implantation = "path/to/implantation.csv",   path_follow_up = "path/to/follow_up",   svy_type = "ech",   svy_weight_implantation = add_weight(annual = "w_ano"),   svy_weight_follow_up = add_weight(monthly = "w_monthly") ) #> Loading required package: data.table #> Error in fread(file = "path/to/implantation.csv"): File 'path/to/implantation.csv' does not exist or is non-readable. getwd()=='/home/runner/work/metasurvey/metasurvey/docs/reference' print(panel_survey) #> Error: object 'panel_survey' not found

text: path Survey file path, file can different formats, csv, xtsx, dta, sav rds svy_type String survey type, supported types; "ech" (Encuensta Continua de Hogares, Uruguay), "eph" ( Encuesta Permanente de Hogares, Argentina), "eai" (Encuesta de Actividades de Innovación, Uruguay) svy_edition String survey edition information, support different time patterns: "YYYYMM"/"MMYYYY" (year- month), "YYYY" (year),  ("YYYY-YYYY") date range svy_weight List survey weight information specifing periodicity  name weight variable. Recomended use helper function add_weight(). svy_psu Primary sampling unit ... arguments passed  load_survey bake Logical inicating recipes processed data loaded. recipes object, using helper function get_recipes()

NULL, remove column. data frame tibble, create multiple columns output. .Strig group variable compute use_copy Logical, FALSE adds new variables reference object like data.table, TRUE adds new variables new object comment String add metadata information stap compute compatible Markdown syntax .level String use Rotative_Panel_survey object indicating data use, level options available;  'implantation' 'follow-'

title: Step recode — step_recode
code: step_recode(   svy = survey_empty(),   new_var,   ...,   .default = NA_character_,   .name_step = NULL,   ordered = FALSE,   use_copy = use_copy_default(),   comment = "Recode step",   .to_factor = FALSE,   .level = "auto" )

title: Step recode — step_recode
text: svy Survey object RotativePanelSurvey new_var Character string new variable create ... sequence two-sided formulas. left hand side (LHS) determines values match case. right hand side (RHS) provides replacement value. LHS inputs must evaluate logical vectors. RHS inputs coerced common type.inputs recycled common size. said, encourage LHS inputs size. Recycling mainly useful RHS inputs, might supply size 1 input recycled size LHS inputs. .default Value replace match found .name_step Character name step identify step survey object, name step provided created automatically ordered Logical, TRUE new variable ordered use_copy Logical, FALSE adds new variables reference object like data.table, TRUE adds new variables new object comment String add metadata information stap compute compatible Markdown syntax .to_factor Logical, TRUE new variable converted factor .level String use Rotative_Panel_survey object indicating data use, level options available;  'implantation' 'follow-'
